text: introducing Amazon recognition video the
easy-to-use API for deep learning based
analysis to detect track and analyze
people and objects in video Amazon
recognition video allows customers to
extract insight from videos stored on s3
as well as real-time face recognition
from live stream via Kinesis video
streams Amazon recognition video uses
the visual what temporal when a motion
from the video to deliver high-quality
person tracking and detection of
activities like running playing soccer
or getting into a car amazon recognition
video allows you to detect and recognize
people in live stream videos this allows
developers to build critical and
immediate responses to events previously
impossible to do in a cost-effective way
replacing manually intensive and
error-prone workflows real-time face
recognition from video livestream
enables secure smart home monitoring
Amazon recognition videos activity and
label detection provides customers with
rich metadata from video for search and
filtering Amazon recognition video
extracts metadata from this video by
detecting objects and activities
with Amazon recognition video customers
can now track persons even when faces
aren't visible tracked persons that are
hidden fully or partially or leave the
scene and reappear customers can now
leverage Amazon recognition videos full
understanding of video context to
generate solutions for investigative
response or event analysis recognize and
track persons of interest from a
collection of tens of millions of faces
even if they go in and out of frame the
Amazon recognition video API is powered
by deep learning based models providing
video analysis for object in scene
detection face detection activity
detection unsafe content detection face
recognition person tracking celebrity
recognition and supporting real-time
face recognition in live streaming to
get started visit the AWS recognition
management console
you
